description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger. 33 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red. The text is framed within a red and black border on fol. 1b. Illuminated headpiece (ʻunwān) in gold, blue and red on fol. 1b. Fol. ii-iii are later additions , with table of contents on fol. (ii)b. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 171". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 645". Incipit: الحمد لله ولا قوة الا بالله وما توفيقي الا بالله والصلاة ... هذا شرح لمختصر القدوري جمعته بالفاظ مختصره وعبارات ظاهرة تشتمل على كثير من المعاني ... كتاب الطهارة الكتاب في اللغة هو الجمع يقال كتبت الشي اي جمعته Explicit: وهو ثلثة وعشرون ثلثة وهو سبعة وثلثان بقى خمسة عشر ثلث وهو نصيبه من التركة وهكذا كل وارث والله اعلم تم الكتاب بحمد الله تعالي وعونه وحسن توفيقه
author: Ḥaddād, Abū Bakr ibn ʻAlī, -1397 or 1398
abstract: Commentary on Mukhtaṣar al-Qudūrī, by Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Qudūrī (d. 428/1037).
extent: iii, 344 leaves: paper ; 260 x 178 (180 x 115) mm. bound to 260 x 200 mm.
title: Jawharat al-nayyirah
provenance: On fol. 1a: note explaining that this copy was taken at the Sūq al-Sulṭānīyah on Muḥarram 1, 1241 [August 16, 1825], signed Aghā(?)-yi Ḥājjī ---? Aghāʹzādah(?) ---? Nūrī in ---?, with seal ; dated 17 M[uḥarram] 1254 [April 12, 1838] ; ownership statement signed al-Ḥājj Muḥammad Nūrī ; ownership statement signed Aḥmad Najīb ibn Aḥmad Ṭāhir, dated 11 D[hū al-Qaʻdah?] [12]79 [1863]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: حداد، ابو بكر بن علي
subject: Qudūrī, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad—Mukhtaṣar al-Qudūrī.
binding note: Brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers, fore-edge flap and envelope flap. Both covers have a central gold stamped mandorla with two pendants on the vertical axis and a border consisting of blind-tooled fillets with three small round stamps on each inner corner. Similar border on the envelope flap, with smaller gold stamp on its point. Blue-dyed paper pastedowns.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
